PPL_9

Class VirtualWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • PPL_9.VirtualWorld

  • public class VirtualWorld
extends java.lang.Object

    This class simulates the Virtual World in which there exist some girls, boys, couples and a variety of gifts.

    Arrays of objects of type Girl, Boy,Gift and Couple are included as instance variables.

    Class responsibility is to simulate real world activities like match-making and gifting through the member functions. Instance Variables:
    girl_ob[] : array of Girl objects
    boy_ob[] : array of Boy objects
    couple_ob[] : array of Couple objects
    gift_ob[] : array of Gift objects

    • Method Detail

      • makeMatches

        public void makeMatches(java.io.BufferedWriter log,
                        int k)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Method to form couples using generic class BestKSelector. BestKSelector first returns best k valued items( according to primary criterion). Then couple is formed with the best item( according to secondary criterion) from selected best k valued items.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • displayMatches

        public void displayMatches()
        Method to display the couples formed.

      • logCouples

        public void logCouples(java.io.BufferedWriter log)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • performGifting

        public void performGifting(java.io.BufferedWriter log,
                           int k)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Method that simulates gift exchanges between couples and logs them in text file "log.txt" according to problem statement using generic class BestKSelector. BestKSelector returns best k valued items Each gift basket is set according to the type of boy: 0-"miser" 1-"geek" 2-"generous". miser always gives cheapest priced gift available till maintenance cost of girl is satisfied geek gives gifts starting from till maintenance cost of girl is satisfied plus one luxury gift if budget allows generous give max cost gifts within their budget
        Parameters:
        log - a BufferedWriter
        k - value of "k"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading/writing file

      • getCoupleStats

        public void getCoupleStats(int k)
        Method to get the happiness and compatibility of each couple.
        Parameters:
        k - variable defined in problem statement
